Posts.Content: barbiecorn wrote: I live in NJ and Sloan Kettering is one of the most trusted hospitals in NYC for cancer.   This is just a general question and I would really like to know your thoughts.   A friend of mine said he was at Sloan last week and there are more young breast cancer woman there for treatment than every seen before.  Just your personal viewpoints.   There were never this many young woman with this dreaded BC.  What do you believe is causing our young woman to get this?  There is something majorly wrong when it is attacking our youth....I personally know a 36 year old and a 23 year old...I can understand more an older person but such young woman???  Your thoughts???? Posts.Title: Don't know where to put this topic barbiecorn kltb04

Posts.Content: May 7, 2012 04:20PM barbiecorn wrote: Good Luck Bev to you and your sister.  I just want to say the BMX which I had in Feb, was not as bad as my mind going crazy about it.  Drains are not that bad either...Never took a pain medication, not even a Tylenol.   I chose not to have reconstruction- I am a very young 66 year old who has been told I look at least ten years younger.  I am not upset that I chose not to have one.  It takes some getting used to...but I was way too large beforehand - 40DD - and now I look great in clothes.  Lost a much needed 30 lbs. also.  My daughter is getting married in June and I bought my boob dress prior to diagnosis and with the prosthetic, it looks great.  I hope you make the right decisionfor yourself.  Try to take a deep breath...it gets easier with time...(((hugs))))
Posts.Title: Sister and I just diagnosed within a week of each other bevg49 AnewBeginning

Posts.Title: Pre-Cancer Breast Diagnosis barbiecorn barbiecorn

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2012 10:47PM barbiecorn wrote: I've been on many of them...bad post-partum 33 years ago and I found Zoloft to be the best for me....Lexapro is very similar I have been told.  I also take xanax to sleep at night - since my diagnosis in Dec. and BMX a couple of weeks ago, I take two xanax a day....my nerves are shot due to the numbness and tightness in my chest which I was told is normal...but I hope this doesn't last too long...I am starting to worry about everything even on the meds...but believe me, without them,I would be in bed with the covers over my head.  I am trying to get myself in shape emotionally and physically for my daughter's wedding in June...If I ever added any conventional treatment on top of this now, I would not be able to take it....Cancer will have to wait for me this time....I am going to enjoy her wedding before any treatments decisions...it is just too much for me to handle now and I don't want to go into another depression...it took me so long to finally reach a point in my life, that life was worth living and I owe it all to the Zoloft and xanax when needed. I say go for it...it is a God send, really!!!!!

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2012 11:52AM barbiecorn wrote: I really don't have any advice for you but want you to know I am thinking about you and wishing you the best....without xanax, I would not have made it through this so far....I already had my surgery 2/1 and drains still in...keep taking the xanax until you are done with this...you really can take it 3 times a day...I take it twice and I also take an anti-depressant Zoloft which I have been on for years...thank God...just let me tell you that the anxiety of waiting for all of this to be over is far far far greater than the reality of the operation, drains, etc.  Keep that in mind...I was a total wreck before and I am now finally seeing the light at the end of the anxiety tunnel.....Good Luck....(((Hugs))) Barbiecorn
